name: Air Fried Char Siu Chicken Wings (Cánh Gà Xá Xíu)
description: A quick and tasty Chinese barbecue chicken wings recipe using an air fryer. These chicken wings have a sweet and savory sticky glaze outside, and tender and flavorful inside. Enjoy the wonderful flavor of char siu in chicken form!
keywords: char siu chicken wings, NOH brand char siu spice packet, Lobo roast red pork seasoning mix, char siu spice mix, char siu spices, char siu chicken recipe, char siu chicken, xa xiu chicken, xa xiu ga, air fryer char siu chicken recipe, air fryer chicken recipe, air fryer char siu, air fryer char siu chicken, easy char siu, what is char siu, what is xa xiu, xá xíu, cha shao, Chinese BBQ chicken recipe, Chinese BBQ chicken, Chinese barbecue chicken, Chinese barbecue chicken recipe, red chicken recipe, red chicken wing recipe, how to make char siu chicken, how to make xa xiu chicken, easy char siew chicken, Chinese BBQ recipe, easy air fryer recipe for chicken, air fryer chicken recipe, air fryer chicken
recipeIngredient: 2½ lbs party wings (chicken wings cut into segments without the tip)
3 tablespoons NOH Chinese Barbecue Char Siu Seasoning Mix
½ teaspoon Chinese Five Spice Powder
recipeInstructions: Prepare the marinade: In a large bowl, whisk together NOH Char Siu spice packet, Chinese five-spice powder, ground black pepper, garlic powder, chicken powder, hoisin sauce, oyster sauce, soy sauce, sesame oil, and sugar.

Place your chicken wings in a large resealable plastic bag or large mixing bowl and pour the marinade over them, making sure that they are evenly coated. Seal the bag or cover the bowl with plastic wrap and place it in the refrigerator for at least one hour, but preferably overnight.
Preheat your air fryer to 300°F. Air fry the chicken wings for 20 minutes. Flipping halfway.

Prepare the glaze by mixing together honey and water until combined and use a pastry brush to brush onto the chicken wings. Air fry again until you get caramelization and a bit of charring on the outside (about 2-4 minutes).
